intro: Pneumonanthe pseudopneumonanthe, commonly known as the false lungwort, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive foliage, which features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a bluish-green hue. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
